isis.stitle: RADIATOR SHUTTERS - OPERATION - HYDRAULIC SHUTTER CONTROLS

svcproc.title: HYDRAULIC SHUTTER CONTROLS
svcproc.para: The normally closed thermal sensing switch is mounted in the engine water jacket. It opens in response to low coolant temperature, and oil pressure actuates the hydraulic solenoid. The hydraulic cylinder rod closes the shutter vanes and keeps them closed until the engine operating temperature rises to the maximum level.
This closes the shutter thermal sensing switch, and oil pressure is removed from the cylinder, allowing the shutter springs to open the vanes.
